that file.


On Friday, September 12, 2003, at 06:57 AM, yijiangusa wrote:

> Dear Dave,
>
> Where to download cantera 1.5 for Windows?
> At the SourceForge site, I can only see v1.5 for unix dated on Aug 25.
> Thanks,
>
> Yi J.
> --- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, David Goodwin <dgoodwin@c...> wrote:
>> Cantera 1.5 for Windows has been released.  This is a major release
>> with many new capabilities; if you are using Cantera on a Windows
> PC, I
>> encourage you to upgrade to 1.5.
>>
>> The release includes:
>> - demos in MATLAB, Python, Fortran 77, and C++ (all have been
> tested
>> and are now working)
>> - compiled Cantera libraries (both debug and release versions) for
>> linking to Fortran or C++ applications
>> - all Cantera C++ header files
>> - a converter program to convert Chemkin reaction mechanism files
> to
>> the new Cantera format
>> - PowerPoint presentations covering installation, building Fortran
>> applications, and the Python and MATLAB demos
>>
>> Among the examples are premixed burner-stabilized flames, detached
>> stagnation-point flames, non-premixed counterflow flames, catalytic
>> combustion in stagnation flow, a CVD problem with elementary
> surface
>> chemistry, zero-D reactors with surface chemistry, ...
>>
>> Hope you enjoy it.
>>
>> Dave G.
>
>
